meanings.sent1: The olives had an oleaginousness that made them perfect for pressing into oil.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a special tool to check the oleaginousness of the car's engine.
meanings.sent3: The chef's salad dressing had an unexpected oleaginousness that made it taste like a gourmet dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush glided across the canvas with an oleaginousness that created a beautiful sheen.
meanings.sent5: The snake's scales glistened with an oleaginousness that made it look slippery and smooth.

meanings.definition: Excessively smooth or ingratiating in manner or speech.
meanings.sent1: The salesman's oleaginousness made customers feel uncomfortable as he tried to sell them the product.
meanings.sent2: Her boss's oleaginousness was evident in the way he always complimented everyone to get what he wanted.
meanings.sent3: The politician's oleaginousness was so over-the-top that even his supporters found it insincere.
meanings.sent4: The actor's oleaginousness on stage was so convincing that the audience believed every word he said.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's oleaginousness towards the principal was obvious to everyone in the school.
